means: 停工（业主为抵制工人的要求而停工）

sentence.Network_en: Switch lockout prevents accidental activation during transport or storage.
sentence.Network_cn: 特殊设计的开关装置防止在运输与存放时点亮.

sentence.Network_en: The standard safety lockout mechanism helps prevent accidental or unauthorized use.
sentence.Network_cn: 标准的安全锁装置能防止错误操作.

sentence.Network_en: The employer Used a lockout to break up the employee strike.
sentence.Network_cn: 雇主为了压制雇员的罢工,采取了封闭工厂的(强硬)手段.

entry.tran: （雇主）封厂，闭厂（以逼迫工人接受新的薪资或工作条件）
entry.def: A lock-out is a situation in which employers close a place of work and prevent workers from entering it until the workers accept the employer's new proposals on pay or conditions of work.

means.word_mean: 1. a management action resisting employee's demands; employees are barred from entering the workplace until they agree to terms
